articles.headline: U.S. Presses China to Stop Flow of Fentanyl
articles.snippet: President Biden put pressure on Xi Jinping to crack down on the Chinese facilities that make chemical compounds used in potent drugs.
articles.abstract: President Biden put pressure on Xi Jinping to crack down on the Chinese facilities that make chemical compounds used in potent drugs.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden pressed the Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Wednesday to crack down on the Chinese firms that are helping to produce fentanyl, a potent drug that has killed hundreds of thousands of Americans.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Keith Bradsher

articles.headline: G.M.’s Contract Deal With U.A.W. Faces Surprisingly Stiff Opposition
articles.snippet: Many longstanding General Motors workers have been voting against the tentative accord, which they feel insufficiently improves retirement benefits.
articles.abstract: Many longstanding General Motors workers have been voting against the tentative accord, which they feel insufficiently improves retirement benefits.
articles.lead_paragraph: A United Automobile Workers union vote on a tentative contract agreement with General Motors that provides record wage increases has run into unexpectedly strong resistance from veteran workers.

articles.headline: Israel Seizes Gaza Hospital That Became Symbol of the War Itself
articles.snippet: A raid of a hospital that Israel asserts is a base for Hamas is shaping up as a watershed moment in a conflict that has put the Mideast on edge.
articles.abstract: A raid of a hospital that Israel asserts is a base for Hamas is shaping up as a watershed moment in a conflict that has put the Mideast on edge.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since Israel’s ground troops invaded Gaza 19 days ago, the fate of its war has become largely entwined with the fate of the territory’s largest hospital.
articles.byline: By Patrick Kingsley and Iyad Abuheweila

articles.headline: How R.F.K. Jr. Has Turned His Public Crusades Into a Private Windfall
articles.snippet: The causes Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has championed have brought him admiration, criticism — and tens of millions of dollars.
articles.abstract: The causes Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has championed have brought him admiration, criticism — and tens of millions of dollars.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2021, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. earned more than $500,000 as the chairman and top lawyer at Children’s Health Defense, the nonprofit organization that he has helped build into a leading spreader of anti-vaccine falsehoods and a platform for launching his independent bid for the White House.

articles.headline: They Trudge From Russia Into Ukraine, Fleeing Life Under Occupation
articles.snippet: About 100 Ukrainians a day travel back into Ukraine at an unofficial border crossing, bringing tales of repression and fear about life in Russian-controlled territories.
articles.abstract: About 100 Ukrainians a day travel back into Ukraine at an unofficial border crossing, bringing tales of repression and fear about life in Russian-controlled territories.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Russian soldiers turned up at her home close to midnight with an ominous message.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Maria Varenikova, Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Tyler Hicks

articles.headline: Pandas, Ping-Pong and Profits: Chinese Leader Woos U.S. C.E.O.s
articles.snippet: Amid frosty U.S.-China relations, Xi Jinping emphasized friendship in an address to executives from Apple, Boeing, Nike and others.
articles.abstract: Amid frosty U.S.-China relations, Xi Jinping emphasized friendship in an address to executives from Apple, Boeing, Nike and others.
articles.lead_paragraph: The streets outside the San Francisco hotel where the Chinese leader, Xi Jinping, addressed a crowd of American business executives Wednesday night were chaotic, echoing with police sirens and the chants of protesters. A woman had strapped herself to a pole 25 feet in the air in front of the hotel, yelling “Free Tibet!” as a cold rain fell.

articles.headline: Retailers Wary of Squeeze on Shoppers Ahead of Key Holiday Season
articles.snippet: Consumers have bucked expectations despite high inflation and interest rates, but retailers worry whether they can keep it up through the end of the year.
articles.abstract: Consumers have bucked expectations despite high inflation and interest rates, but retailers worry whether they can keep it up through the end of the year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Days ahead of the start of the holiday shopping season, several major retailers expressed caution about consumers during the busiest selling period of the year.
articles.byline: By J. Edward Moreno and Jordyn Holman

articles.headline: Cryptocurrency Prices Surge, Driven by a Potential Bitcoin Fund
articles.snippet: Investors anticipate regulatory approval of an exchange traded fund linked directly to Bitcoin, which they hope will encourage more people to invest in the digital asset.
articles.abstract: Investors anticipate regulatory approval of an exchange traded fund linked directly to Bitcoin, which they hope will encourage more people to invest in the digital asset.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a Manhattan courtroom this month, the cryptocurrency industry faced a reckoning as its onetime star, Sam Bankman-Fried, was convicted of fraud in a trial that put the industry’s excesses on vivid display.
